messages.subject: Re: Reading Rainbow
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/17/2003 8:24:21 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... When Julian was wee and he got his first real bed, we told him he could pick out whatever
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/17/2003 8:24:21 AM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Sitting here flipping through the TV I caught the Emmy
> Awards on. It just so happened that LeVar Burton won
> and emmy for the best children's series Reading
> Rainbow.
>
> He said that this may be the last year of the show due
> to lack of funds.
>
> I feel this is something that can't happen. I have a
> hard time with this happening when there is so much
> stuff on there that is not good.
>
> Thank you for letting me sound off.
>
>

When Julian was wee and he got his first real bed, we told him he could pick
out whatever kind of sheets he wanted for it.

He asked for Levar sheets, which unfortunately did not exist. We loved
Reading Rainbow. I'm sad it might end. And I'm still so sad about the death
of Fred.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
